qas.question: What city is now located where Fort Duquesne was built?
Were the British successful in stopping the building of Fort Duquesne?

answers.text: British attempts to halt this fort construction were unsuccessful

qas.question: Who led the British militia to drive the French out of Fort Duquesne?
Where did the French for General George Washington's surrender?

context: The most important French fort planned was intended to occupy a position at "<a0_0>the Forks" where the Allegheny and Monongahela Rivers meet to form the Ohio River<a0_0/> (present day <a1_0>Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania<a1_0/>). Peaceful <a2_0>British attempts to halt this fort construction were unsuccessful<a2_0/>, and the French proceeded to build the fort they named Fort Duquesne. British colonial militia from Virginia were then sent to drive them out. <a3_0>Led by George Washington<a3_0/>, they ambushed a small French force at Jumonville Glen on 28 May 1754 killing ten, including commander Jumonville. The French retaliated by attacking Washington's army at <a4_0>Fort Necessity<a4_0/> on 3 July 1754 and forced Washington to surrender.
